DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study assess safety tolerability novel positron emission tomography ( PET ) tracer [ 11C ] BMT-136088 healthy adult subject measurement availability Lysophosphatidic Acid ( LPA1 ) receptor human lung use tracer ass LPA1 receptor occupancy use [ 11C ] BMT-136088 human lung follow oral administration Bristol Myers Squibb ( BMS ) -986020 .
DOC.brief_title: To Evaluate The Relationship Between Plasma Drug Levels And Receptor Binding Lung Using PET ( Positron Emission Tomography ) In Healthy Volunteers
DOC.criteria: For information regard BMS clinical trial participation , please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com Body weight least 50kg ( 110lbs ) , Body Mass Index ( BMI ) within 19 32 kg/m2 , inclusive Must good health determine medical history , physical examination , ECG , serum/urine biochemistry , hematology , serology test Negative hepatitis panel negative human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) antibody screen Any history presence clinically significant respiratory , Gastro Intestinal ( GI ) , renal , hepatic , pancreatic , hematological , neurological ( include history seizure ) , cardiovascular , psychiatric ( include know addictive disorder ) , musculoskeletal , genitourinary , immunological , dermatological disorder , include cancer Any acute chronic condition , opinion investigator consultation BMS Medical Monitor , could jeopardize subject 's safety , tolerability , pharmacokinetics BMS986020 Any major surgery within 4 week study drug administration Existence cold , upper respiratory tract infection , fever within 5 day prior checkin Presence history abnormality illness may affect absorption , distribution , metabolism elimination study drug Donation blood plasma ( exclude screen visit ) within 2 month prior check end synthesis ( EOS ) , inclusive
